name: linearly
content:
linearly adverb
(ORDER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves events or thoughts following another one directly, in a clear order: The story does not progress linearly from one event in the character's life to the next. Key arguments are scattered throughout the book instead of being built up linearly.
More examplesFewer examplesThe book is not designed to be read linearly.I've been thinking too linearly, reacting too straightforwardly to the things in front of me.

linearly adverb
(MATHEMATICS & SCIENCE)
mathematics, science
  specialized in a way in which one thing changes at the same rate as another, so that the relationship between them does not change: This graph shows that the initial rate of reaction increases linearly. The speed of the dots increased linearly with distance from the centre.
More examplesFewer examplesThe "fee" doesn't increase linearly with time.The minimum cavity pressure decreases linearly with increasing entry velocity over the test range.They found that both at age 4 and age 6, duration of deprivation was linearly related to the number of signs of attachment disorders.
